results.title: Nigel & Frank meet their matchbox
results.creator_credit: Sam Howie and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A light-hearted animated story of friendship and just how far two old mates will let greed and envy come between them when they discover a magic matchbox. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Howie and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: Terra firma
results.brief_description:
This cut-out animation started life as a 5-metre long conte drawing inspired by the various unseen energies that influence and create a dimension.
Original music by Steve Fraser, Dennis Phelan, Luke Von Banbergern. Animation by Julian lawrence.

results.title: Thrown away
results.brief_description:
A man contemplates suicide in a public lavatory cubicle. An unseen figure enters the space and proceeds to carry out the exact sequence ofevents that have bought the man to this critical moment. Is somebody playing a trick on him, or is this his doppelganger? Alarm turns to curiosity and he decides to investigate.
Written, directed and edited by Dan Thomas and featuring Christopher Hatherall as the man.

results.title: Skyfall
results.creator_credit: Lu Gao, Robby Susanto and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Great collaboration between a 2D and 3D animator to create a composite of cutout animation styles. A series of landscapes are degraded by human activities, in a dreamlike meditation on the despoilment of nature.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Opposites attract
results.creator_credit: Elin Bakken Tonder and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A shy retiring little man and his glamourous neighbour share meaningful looks as they pass each other in the hallway. He is entranced by her ravishing outfits, she is a little lonely and thinks ‘why not?’. But there is a twist in the tale of this claymation. Music by Matt Archer.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: The Moment
results.creator_credit: Apid Busayasiri and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A young man goes to visit the grave of his grandmother at a remote graveyard on the outskirts of a city. While he is there a series of mysterious events unfold that magically transport him back to his joyful childhood. Hand drawn animation.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Karma
results.creator_credit: Shu Wang and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Stylish and artistic 3D animation explores the karmic implications of eating animals.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Fluid
results.creator_credit: Lachlan Dean and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
An animated ink blot transverses the treacherous terrain contained within a sketchbook of ideas as scarey doodles attack it from every side.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
